Posts.Content: Yes!! I didn’t get anything yesterday, now I’m getying every group I’m not a member of and NOT the ones I am!!  So frustrating!!
Posts.Title: Problem with updates - again

Posts.Content: Thank you, I’m just having a meltdown, everyone is going on holiday looking forward to their summers. And I am dreading mine. I need to get started, know what it is, join the rest of you! I’ve got a friend to come with me yes, I hope the stand in oncologist is nice, as mine is away on holiday before I’ve had the chance to meet him .
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Hi there, I'm a new y too, but can't work out how to join this group? Help!
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Hi Karen, I start Chemo on more or less the same day, I’ve been watching YouTube videos, some good advice there.
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Thanks for the explanation, it helps a lot. I start next week, not sure which day. I’ll be joining you all soon, the sooner I start the sooner I finish and all that. How are you all coping in the heat? The good thing about living in Batcelona is I have air con, which will be a blessing g I feel!
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Thanks , i will try that. Hopefully it will work!  Take care xx
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: You go girl!! Onward and upward!!  Be catching you up soon!!
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Thank you xxx Believe it or not I’m in Barcelona, where a lot of people are coming on holiday! But they say the sun is bad when you’re on chemo, so I’ll have to leave my going out to the night time.  I’m in the Hospital Sant Pau , and my oncologist is the consultant there, I’m lucky, a friend put in a good word for me with him. But I won’t meet him till September, pity.  I odered a wig online but the WiFi connection was bad and I clicked too many times. In the end I ordered 4 of the same!! Over a grand!! ive written to them and I’m waiting for a reply, I can’t seem to do anything g right these days!  I WILL get through this, I know I will, it’s just as you said too many bad things have happened and it sometimes gets to me.  Mom normally a happy go lucky person, it’s not like me to be so down, which is probably why I’m not coping too well.  Thanks again xx
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Good luck! The doctors here mostly do chemo first to reduce the size so as not to cut into so much tissue, not many have surgery first.
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Just a thought, in Spain it’s tge social security not the NHS so the SS will be treating me!! I hope they are nothing like their namesake!  Seriosky they have been wonderful, gave me a pink cushion and everything, there’s even a similar centre to Maggie’s centre at my hospital, I feel spoilt!!
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Here is a piece of advice from Spain, I was told by someone I know who started her chemo today that everybody was telling her to make thyme herbal tea, with fresh thyme. Strain it and put it in the fridge, every time you walk by give yourself drink and swirl it around your mouth a few times, even gargle, take it to your sessions too! It works!! And can stop the mouth ulcers!!  Anyone got any more tips?
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Yes, but the thyme herbal tea isnt just for cancer, it’s for anyone with mouth problems, it’s a natural remedy, dentists here tell you to use it as a mouth wash instead of the expensive shop bought ones. It’s teied and tested.  It also makes you drink more water, so it’s two birds one stone!!  Anything that’s keeping you hydrated can’t be bad!!
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: It's all getting too real, I'm still limping from a broken ankle! Tomorrow I've got my echocardiogram and Thursday they are putting the markers in. The next week it all starts, its very difficult to believe, all of the women who have been through this, now me, I can't quite register it all.
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Hi there, glad it’s all going well but could you explain exactly what the crash is? Is it tiredness, tears? I’d love to know to prepare myself!!
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Oh yes and Soya is a no no too!! Not good for anyone with cancer!!
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Hi, I haven’t written anything for a while, I think I was trying to make believe this wasn’t happening to me...... but tomorrow it’s here , my date with the oncologist, I’ll find out if it’s contained in the right breast or not, and o can ask questions, but haven’t a clue what to ask. I had a teary night last night , I do t cry in front of the kids, or I try not to. Today is my last, tomorrow I have to face the harsh reality that I have BC.
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Thanks, that's reassuring but I've read somewhere about over 5cm being bad. I thought it was only 2.5 cm but got a shock when I saw the MRI results. I'm still in a daze.
Posts.Title: How big is your lump?

Posts.Content: I’ve only been ‘here’ for a few hours but I already know what you mean. You all know what I’m going through, why didn’t I find you last weekend when I was lost and crying into my pillow? But I have you now, I’m so grateful to everybody who has been answering my question, thank you all so much.
Posts.Title: How big is your lump?

Posts.Content: Thank you so much! You are making me feel that I am not alone in this. No one in my family has ever had cancer, it’s all so new to all of them. My parents are both 88 years old and I dint know what to tell them. This will help a lot!
Posts.Title: How big is your lump?

Posts.Content: It's so good to talk to people who know where I'm coming from. I've just been to have a wig fitted, it's all so surreal, like this is not my life? I would have preferred a new phone, but I'm getting a wig, who knows I might use it even when my hair is growing out? One good thing is , it'll last a lot longer than a new iPhone !
Posts.Title: How big is your lump?

Posts.Content: I'm reading about lumps of mm my lump is 8.1 cm, has anyone got a lump that's measured in cm? I'm getting very worried. I have 4 mm tumors too , is there hope?
Posts.Title: How big is your lump?

Posts.Content: Thanks, I can't find anything about things like that.
Posts.Title: How big is your lump?
